basics.name: Ala ªi Paikai
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Computational Humanities in the Department of Interdisciplinary Studies at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Summer, 2024.

research interests.name: Large language model building for low-resource and endangered languages
Education, outreach, and writing on Pacific Island studies
Genealogical research in archives focusing on Pacific and Hawaiian Kingdom era history
Library and information science with a focus on archiving and digital preservation

work.summary: Processed orders and resolved technical issues within the network engineering department.
highlights: Collaborated with companies to extend service to remote areas and worked with Hawaiian communities on Molokai to bridge technological gaps and improve connectivity.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
